DataElement.preferredName: Recurrent/Refractory Disease Or Refuse Therapeutic Procedure To Extend Life Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Code Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A coded response to questions which are necessary to allow a person to participate in a clinical study that are related a recurrent, refractory disease and therapy refusal to  prolong life as outlined in the protocol.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Recurrent Disease Refractory Disease Or Refuse Therapeutic Procedure To Extend Life Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The return of a disease after a period of remission._A disease that resists treatment._An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise._To decline to do, accept, give, or allow something._An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process._Used as a function word to indicate direction, purpose, or movement._To increase in length or duration._The organic phenomenon that distinguishes living organisms from nonliving ones; showing characteristics of life._Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The return of a disease after a period of remission.

Concepts.definition: The return of a disease after a period of remission.

Property.preferredName: Refractory Disease Or Refuse Therapeutic Procedure To Extend Life Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
Property.preferredDefinition: A disease that resists treatment.:An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.:To decline to do, accept, give, or allow something.:An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process.:Used as a function word to indicate direction, purpose, or movement.:To increase in length or duration.:The organic phenomenon that distinguishes living organisms from nonliving ones; showing characteristics of life.:Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

Concepts.definition: An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.
To decline to do, accept, give, or allow something.
An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process.
Used as a function word to indicate direction, purpose, or movement.
To increase in length or duration.
Showing characteristics of life; displaying signs of life.
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Indicator to represent a response of Yes, No, or Not Applicable._The affirmative response to a question or activity._The non-affirmative response to a question._Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context._A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

Concepts.definition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.:The non-affirmative response to a question.:Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.:An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.
The non-affirmative response to a question.
Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created to support Theradex design of CRFs for NCI CCR trials

ReferenceDocuments.name: For Part 1: If patient has T
ReferenceDocuments.description: For Part 1: If patient has T Cell or NK Cell Lymphomas, is disease refractory to, intolerant of, has relapsed following, or patient has refused all standard life-prolonging therapies?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has lymphoma, has patient exhausted or refused potential curative therapy prior to enrolling?
